log.input:
Please write a Vpython animation to simulate "horizontal projectile motion."

1. Basic Introduction & Parameter Settings
The length of the floor is 25. From the X-coordinate position -10, horizontally launch a ball with a radius of 0.5 at a height of 15, with an initial speed of 5.

2. Screen Settings
Set the canvas center at (0, 7.5, 0). Please draw the trajectory of the ball's motion. Do not adjust the size of the scene.

3. Object Motion
Assume that the ball has an elastic collision with the ground, considering only the effect of gravity, meaning the ball accelerates downwards under gravity and bounces upon hitting the ground. Stop the motion of the ball when it reaches the X-coordinate position 12.5.

Cyber Input Variable Mapping Information:

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=0.5

(2) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(3) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math, sympy, scipy and time.
log.output:
from vpython import *

# parameter settings
g = 9.8
v0 = 5
height = 15
length = 25
Radius_I = 0.5

# screen settings
scene = canvas(center=vec(0, 7.5, 0), width=800, height=800)

# objects
ball = sphere(pos=vec(-10, height, 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red, make_trail=True, v=vec(v0, 0, 0))
floor = box(pos=vec(0, -0.01, 0), size=vec(length, 0.02, 0.2), color=color.green)

# motion
while ball.pos.x < 12.5:
    rate(100)
    ball.pos = ball.pos + ball.v*dt
    if ball.pos.y - Radius_I <= 0 and ball.v.y < 0:
        ball.v.y = -ball.v.y
    else:
        ball.v.y = ball.v.y - g*dt
